2234.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $125,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Chesterwye Center, Inc. for the planning, design, construction, and capital equipping of Jessie's House, located in Grasonville; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

2238.title: Private Property Rights - Regulatory Infringement - Compensation
2238.description: Giving an owner of private property a cause of action under specified circumstances against the Department of the Environment, the Department of Natural Resources, or the Department of Planning if the application of specified regulations infringes on a private property right; providing that the cause of action shall be filed in a specified court; providing for the sum that a private property owner may recover; etc.

2243.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Senate Rules Withdrawn
2243.title: Baltimore City - Video Lottery Terminals - Proceeds and Equipment
2243.description: Altering the distribution of proceeds of video lottery terminals to the video lottery operation licensee in Baltimore City under specified circumstances; clarifying that specified requirements regarding minority business participation and employment apply to a specified video lottery operation licensee in Baltimore City; and authorizing the licensee in Baltimore City to own or lease each video lottery terminal device and the associated equipment and software used in the video lottery facility.

2251.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2251.title: State Board of Dental Examiners - Dentists - Advertisements - Materials
2251.description: Authorizing licensed dentists to advertise specified information relating to their dental practices and materials containing mercury; and prohibiting the State Board of Dental Examiners from requiring a specified advertisement to contain a disclaimer.

2254.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2254.title: State Board of Dental Examiners - Dentists - Informed Consent - Removal of
2254.description: Requiring dentists to obtain written informed consent from patients prior to performing any dental procedures or treatments that include the removal of dental materials containing mercury; specifying the content of written informed consent; requiring dentists to keep the original informed consent in a specified chart; and requiring the State Board of Dental Examiners to adopt specified regulations.

2256.title: Economic Development - Qualified Distressed Counties
2256.description: Altering the definition of "qualified distressed county" for specified purposes, including the Maryland Economic Development Assistance Authority and Fund, the Linked Deposit Program, the One Maryland Economic Development Tax Credit, and the College Readiness Outreach Program.

2257.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2002 and 2009 - Montgomery County -
2257.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2002 and 2009 to extend the deadline for the Board of Directors of CHI Centers, Inc. to present evidence that a matching fund will be provided for a specified grant; requiring that the Board of Public Works expend or encumber the proceeds of the loans by June 1, 2013; etc.

2258.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2009 - Montgomery County - LEDC
2258.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2009 to extend the deadline for the Board of Directors of the Latino Economic Development Corporation to present evidence that a matching fund will be provided; requiring that the Board of Public Works expend or encumber the proceeds of the loan by June 1, 2013; etc.

2260.title: Medical Professional Liability Insurance for Nonprofit Health Care Providers
2260.description: Requiring counties to provide specified minimum amounts of medical professional liability insurance for specified nonprofit health care providers; etc.

2261.last_action: Favorable with Amendments Report by Ways and Means
2261.title: St. Mary's County Board of Elections - Salary
2261.description: Increasing the salary of the members of the St. Mary's County Board of Elections to $3,600; and providing that the Act does not apply to the salary or compensation of the incumbent members of the St. Mary's County Board of Elections.

2262.title: Junk Dealers and Scrap Metal Processors - Required Records and Hold Period
2262.description: Requiring specified junk dealers and scrap metal processors to submit digital photographs of individuals from whom junk or scrap metal is acquired to law enforcement units under specified circumstances; and requiring specified junk dealers and scrap metal processors to hold specified items of junk and scrap metal for 3 business days.

2263.title: St. Mary's County - Noncertificated Public School Employees - Service Fee
2263.description: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Board of Education to negotiate with specified employee organizations for employees a reasonable service fee to be charged nonmember noncertificated employees for representing the employees in specified matters; and making the Act applicable only to specified employees hired on or after a specified date.

2264.title: St. Mary's County - Certificated Public School Employees - Service or
2264.description: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Board of Education to negotiate with the employee organization designated as the exclusive representative for a unit of specified certificated employees as to a service or representation fee for representing nonmember certificated employees in the unit in specified matters; and making the Act applicable only to employees hired on or after July 1, 2011.

2272.title: Creation of a State Debt - Charles County - Bel Alton High School Community
2272.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $100,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Bel Alton High School Alumni Association Community Development Corporation for the construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of a community development center, including window repair, located in La Plata; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

2275.title: Horse Racing - State Racing Commission - Membership
2275.description: Requiring that the Governor select a specified number of members of the State Racing Commission from a list provided by specified associations and from specified members of the public at large; and requiring that the Governor select the chairperson of the State Racing Commission in a specified manner.

2278.title: Caroline County - Board of Elections - Membership and Compensation
2278.description: Increasing to five the number of regular members of the Caroline County Board of Elections; requiring the members of the local board to be of specified political parties; requiring a vacancy on the local board to be filled in a specified manner; increasing the amount of compensation for the president and other regular members of the local board; making the Act effective June 6, 2011; etc.

2280.title: Creation of a State Debt - Talbot County - Shore UP Head Start - Easton
2280.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $600,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of Shore UP!, Inc. for the planning, design, and construction of the Shore UP! head start facility at Easton Elementary School, located in Easton; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

2283.title: Real Property - Recordation of Deed - Foreclosure Sales
2283.description: Requiring, in the case of a foreclosure sale, a deed to be recorded within 60 days after the date of the final order of ratification.

2287.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation Withdrawn
2287.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 - Baltimore City - Mary Harvin
2287.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 to extend the deadline by which a specified grantee must present evidence that a matching fund will be provided; etc.

2292.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation Withdrawn
2292.title: Property Tax Exemption for Charitable or Educational Purposes - Property for
2292.description: Adding specified requirements for property to be eligible for a specified property tax exemption for property used for charitable or educational purposes; requiring the Department of Assessments and Taxation to adopt regulations related to the specified requirements; applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2011; etc.

2293.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2293.title: Procurement - Preferences - Blind Industries and Services of Maryland
2293.description: Altering a specified preference to allow the preference to apply to the Blind Industries and Services of Maryland when subcontracting for supplies and services under specified circumstances.

2294.title: Firearms - Knowing Violation of Specified Prohibitions - Penalty
2294.description: Specifying that it is a misdemeanor punishable by imprisonment for up to 5 years or a fine of up to $10,000 or both to knowingly violate the prohibition against the possession of a regulated firearm or ammunition solely designed for a regulated firearm by a person who is under the age of 21, or to knowingly violate the prohibition against obliterating, removing, changing, or altering the manufacturer's identification mark or number on a firearm.

2297.title: Calvert County - Alcoholic Beverages - Special Event License
2297.description: Establishing a Special Event (SE) beer, wine and liquor license in Calvert County; specifying that the license entitles the holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for consumption on the licensed premises; requiring that an applicant for the license first obtain approval of the Board for specified items; specifying that the license may be valid for 1 or more days; authorizing the Board to approve multiple venues where alcoholic beverages may be sold on the licensed premises; making the Act an emergency measure; etc.

2299.title: Nursing Homes - Staffing Requirements
2299.description: Requiring a nursing home, on or before May 1, 2013, to provide sufficient staff to ensure that at least 3.67 hours of direct care are provided per resident per day; requiring a nursing home, on or before May 1, 2013, to distribute nursing staff to meet specified minimum shift ratios; requiring a nursing home to submit a proposed shift schedule to the Office of Health Care Quality at least 1 week before the schedule is to be implemented; etc.

2302.title: Natural Resources Police Force - Number of Officers
2302.description: Stating the intent of the General Assembly that the Natural Resources Police Force employ at least 435 Natural Resources police officers by fiscal year 2021; authorizing under specified circumstances, beginning in fiscal year 2013 and continuing each subsequent year, the Natural Resources Police Force to increase the number of cadets and recruits enrolling in the Maryland Natural Resources Police Academy until a specified goal is met; etc.

2303.title: Parking Violations - Administrative Enforcement by Baltimore County - Pilot
2303.description: Authorizing Baltimore County, by ordinance, to establish an alternative enforcement program for the issuance of civil parking citations for violations of specified restrictions on the stopping, standing, or parking of vehicles; requiring an ordinance adopted under the Act to provide for a specified judicial review in the Circuit Court for Baltimore County; requiring an ordinance adopted under the Act to require a specified notification to the Motor Vehicle Administration; etc.

2304.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2304.title: Commission on Organic and Locally Grown Agricultural Products
2304.description: Establishing a Commission on Organic and Locally Grown Agricultural Products; specifying the membership, chairs, staff, and duties of the Commission; specifying that a member of the Commission may not receive compensation, but is entitled to reimbursement; requiring the Commission to analyze, study, and make recommendations regarding ways the State can promote the development, sale, and use of organic and locally grown agricultural products; requiring the Commission to make a report to the Governor and the General Assembly; etc.

2306.title: Title Insurance - Closing Protection
2306.description: Requiring a title insurer, its agent, or its employee that accepts a specified closing protection fee under specified circumstances to provide specified notice about the closing protection fee in a specified manner; requiring title insurers under specified circumstances to provide specified protected parties with reimbursement for actual loss of the protected party's trust money that is converted or misappropriated by the title insurer, title insurance producers, or their employees; etc.

2308.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs Withdrawn
2308.title: State Board of Education - Student Member - Voting Rights
2308.description: Authorizing the student member of the State Board of Education to vote on specified personnel matters and appeals.

2311.title: Condominiums and Homeowners Associations - Priority of Liens - "The Residential
2311.description: Providing that, in the case of a foreclosure on a mortgage or deed of trust on or for a condominium unit, the portion of a lien on the condominium unit that represents up to 6 months of specified unpaid assessments, including specified fees and costs, has priority over a first mortgage or deed of trust under specified circumstances; providing that lot owners in a homeowners association are liable for specified assessments and charges; etc.

2313.title: Harford County - One or Two Family Dwellings Constructed as Industrialized
2313.description: Establishing the date for complying with the requirement for installation of automatic fire sprinkler systems in one- or two-family dwellings constructed as industrialized buildings in Harford County; making the Act an emergency measure; and terminating the Act at the end of June 30, 2011.

2314.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs Withdrawn
2314.title: Prince George's County - Single Bottles or Cans of Beer - Size Prohibition
2314.description: Authorizing the Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners to prohibit Class A beer, Class A beer and light wine, or Class A beer, wine and liquor licensees from selling single bottles or cans of beer for consumption off the licensed premises in bottles or cans sized 10 ounces or less, or more than 16 ounces.

2316.title: Prince George's County - Foreclosed-On Property Registry
2316.description: Authorizing Prince George's County to enact a local law establishing a foreclosed-on property registry for specified property located in the county; requiring the local law to require a successor in interest to register specified foreclosed-on property, pay a specified registration fee, be responsible for the maintenance and security of the foreclosed-on property, and provide the county with specified information on the property; requiring the county to set up a fund for the deposit of registration fees for specified uses; etc.

2319.title: Prince George's County - Real Property - Age 55 and Older - Residential Leases
2319.description: Requiring a landlord to offer a 36-month residential lease for residential dwelling structures in Prince George's County offered for rent to individuals age 55 years and older; limiting the application of the Act to properties composed of at least five dwelling units and to properties that have received funding from the State on or after October 1, 2011, used for construction of or improvements to the structure; and requiring the 36-month lease to be offered to specified individuals and lessees.

2321.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Vesta Glenarden Facility
2321.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $100,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of Vesta, Inc. for the renovation and reconstruction of the Vesta Glenarden Facility, located in Glenarden; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

2323.title: Maryland Clean Energy Incentive Act - Qualified Energy Resources
2323.description: Altering the definition of qualified energy resources under a specified credit against the State income tax for specified electricity produced from specified qualified resources to eliminate the restriction that nonhazardous waste material be in either solid or cellulosic form; etc.

2324.title: Bio-Heating Oil - Income Tax Credit
2324.description: Altering the definition of bio-heating oil for purposes of a State income tax credit for the purchase of bio-heating oil for specified purposes; extending the termination provision for the income tax credit to June 30, 2018; altering dates of applicability for the credit; etc.

2326.title: State Vehicle Fleet and Gasoline Service Facilities - Use and Selling of
2326.description: Altering the requirement that the State ensure that at least a specified percentage of vehicles using diesel fuel in the State vehicle fleet use a blend of fuel containing at least a specified percentage of biodiesel fuel to include the use of biofuels; providing that a provision does not apply to a State vehicle, piece of heavy equipment, or heating equipment for which mechanical failure due to use of a specified biofuel will void a specified manufacturer's warranty; repealing specified requirements; etc.

2329.title: Renewable Energy - Poultry Litter - Net Energy Metering and Renewable Energy
2329.description: Altering the definition of eligible customer-generator to include a person who owns and operates, leases and operates, or contracts with a third party that owns and operates, a specified poultry litter electric generating facility; stating the findings of the General Assembly; altering the renewable energy portfolio standard to require specified percentages of energy derived from Tier 1 renewable sources to be derived from poultry litter-to-energy sources in specified years; etc.

2330.last_action: Favorable with Amendments Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2330.title: Prince George's County - Age for Compulsory Public School Attendance -
2330.description: Increasing the age for compulsory public school attendance in Prince George's County to be until 18 years old; requiring specified parents or guardians of specified children to provide written consent before the children may withdraw from public school attendance; requiring a county superintendent, school principal, or other specified school official to provide a specified written notification under specified circumstances; etc.

2332.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2010 - Prince George's County - John
2332.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2010 to allow the Mayor and Common Council of the City of Seat Pleasant to include the value of real property in a specified matching requirement for the construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of the John E. Feggens Center.

2334.title: Labor and Employment - Administrative Leave - Parent-Teacher Conferences
2334.description: Authorizing an employee to use administrative leave to attend a parent-teacher conference; requiring an employee to notify the employer at least 3 days before the employee will use administrative leave to attend a parent-teacher conference; prohibiting an employee who uses administrative leave under the Act from using more than 4 hours per parent-teacher conference and using administrative leave more than once per school semester; authorizing an employer to require specified evidence under specified circumstances; etc.

2336.title: Labor and Employment - User Name and Password Privacy Protection
2336.description: Prohibiting an employer from requiring an employee or applicant for employment to disclose user names or passwords for specified Internet sites or Web-based accounts; prohibiting an employer from taking, or threatening to take, specified disciplinary actions for an employee's refusal to disclose specified user name or password information; prohibiting an employer failing or refusing to hire an applicant for employment as a result of the applicant's refusal to disclose specified user name or password information; etc.

2338.title: Legislative Community Initiatives Loan of 2004 - Anne Arundel County - Carrie
2338.description: Amending the Legislative Community Initiatives Loan of 2004 to extend to June 1, 2013, the deadline by which a specified grant must be encumbered by the Board of Public Works or expended for specified purposes; etc.

2341.title: Income Tax - Credit for Charitable Contributions to Community Foundations
2341.description: Providing an individual a credit against the State income tax in an amount equal to 100% of the amount of unrestricted charitable contributions made by the individual to a community foundation's endowment during the taxable year; providing for a reduction of itemized deductions for Maryland income tax purposes if a credit is claimed; allowing the credit only if the individual's qualified capital gain for the taxable year for which the credit is received is at least $10,000,000; applying the Act to tax years after 2010; etc.

2342.title: Freedom of Speech - Picketing at a Funeral - Distance
2342.description: Increasing the distance within which a person is prohibited from engaging in picketing activities at a funeral, burial, memorial service, or funeral procession from 100 feet to 500 feet.

2343.title: Prince George's County - Landlord and Tenant - Reclaiming Property After
2343.description: Authorizing a landlord in Prince George's County to repossess rental premises under specified circumstances after 4 days after a judgment of possession; establishing that the tenant has the right to reclaim any personal property left in the premises within 3 days after the repossession; authorizing the landlord to secure the tenant's personal property in a specified manner; requiring the landlord to allow the tenant to make reasonable arrangements to obtain and move the personal property; etc.

2344.title: Taxation of Corporations - Alternative Minimum Assessment
2344.description: Imposing an alternative minimum assessment (AMA) on corporations doing business in the State; providing for the computation of the AMA as a percentage of a corporation's gross receipts or gross profits, based on an election made by the corporation; limiting the AMA to $5,000,000 for any corporation and to $20,000,000 for affiliated groups of corporations; providing for credits against the corporate income tax under specified circumstances; applying the Act to tax years after 2010; etc.

2345.title: Credit Unions - Boards of Directors - Electronically Conducted Elections
2345.description: Authorizing the election of the board of directors of a credit union to be conducted electronically under specified circumstances; requiring the secretary of a credit union, for an election of directors conducted electronically, to provide specified information and a specified identification form to each member of the credit union in good standing as provided in regulations adopted by the Commissioner of Financial Regulation; requiring the Commissioner to establish specified regulations; etc.

2347.title: Criminal Law - Funerals, Burials, Memorial Services, and Funeral Processions -
2347.description: Increasing the distance within which a person is prohibited from engaging in picketing activities at a funeral, burial, memorial service, or funeral procession from 100 feet to 1,000 feet; and increasing the penalties for specified violations relating to specified activities at funerals, burials, memorial services, and funeral processions.

2348.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2010 - Baltimore City - Long-Term
2348.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2010 to expand the authorized purposes of a grant to the Board of Directors of the Govans Ecumenical Development Corporation, Inc.; etc.

2349.title: Budget Reconciliation and Balancing Act
2349.description: Altering or repealing specified required appropriations; repealing provisions of law regarding stem cell research; altering or repealing specified grant programs; altering or repealing specified funding requirements; altering the calculation of specified State aid for education; altering State aid provided to community colleges and to specified nonpublic institutions of higher education; altering the distribution of specified revenues; altering the use of specified funds; etc.

2353.title: Circuit Court - Civil Actions - Waiver of Discovery Deadlines - Informed
2353.description: Requiring an attorney who is representing a client in a civil action in a circuit court to obtain the informed written consent of the client to waive any discovery deadline set by the court before waiving a discovery deadline.

2354.title: Courts - Civil Matters and Jury Trials - Informed Written Consent
2354.description: Requiring, in specified civil matters, an attorney representing a specified person to demand a jury trial unless the attorney obtains the informed written consent from the client to waive the client's right to a jury trial.

2355.title: Swimming Pools - Automated External Defibrillator Programs
2355.description: Requiring each county or municipality that owns or operates a swimming pool to develop and implement a specified automated external defibrillator program that meets specified requirements for specified swimming pools; requiring the owners and operators of specified swimming pools to develop and implement a specified automated external defibrillator program that meets specified requirements; requiring specified State agencies to adopt regulations; etc.

2356.title: Homeowner's Insurance - Coverage for Other Structures
2356.description: Prohibiting an insurer that issues a policy of homeowner's insurance from requiring the policy to include coverage for other structures such as sheds or outbuildings if the policyholder does not have a shed or outbuilding on the property.

2357.title: Vehicle Laws - Window Tinting - Certification by Inspection Stations
2357.description: Requiring that a specified repair order certification for a violation of specified provisions relating to window tinting on a motor vehicle may be issued only by a registered individual at an inspection station in specified circumstances.

2358.title: Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund - Employee Compensation
2358.description: Providing that employees of the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund are not subject to laws, regulations, or executive orders governing State employee compensation; repealing a requirement for the Executive Director of the Fund to determine the compensation of personnel of the Fund in accordance with the State pay plan; requiring the Executive Director to administer the compensation of the personnel of the Fund; etc.

2360.title: Real Property - Condominiums and Homeowners Associations - Governing Bodies
2360.description: Requiring the governing body of a condominium to convene at least two meetings each year; requiring the developer of a condominium to appoint a unit owner to the governing body within 30 days from the date 25 percent of units are conveyed under specified circumstances; requiring a developer to deliver specified notices regarding a bond provided by the developer to a government agency to each officer or member of the board of directors within 15 days of the meeting of the council of unit owners to elect a board of directors; etc.

2361.title: Sales and Use Tax - Machinery and Equipment - Energy Star Windows and Doors
2361.description: Exempting from the sales and use tax sales of machinery and equipment to be used directly and predominantly to produce Energy Star windows or Energy Star entry doors for residential real property and utilities used to operate the machinery or equipment; etc.

2362.title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Expiration of Licenses - Extension for
2362.description: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County under specified circumstances to extend an alcoholic beverages license for not more than 2 years if the licensed premises is forced to close because of a casualty loss; and making the Act an emergency measure.

2363.title: State Government - Executive Order - Definition
2363.description: Altering the definition of "executive order" to remove from the definition an order or an amendment or a rescission of an order that adopts specified guidelines, rules of conduct, or rules of procedure for specified persons.

2365.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2365.title: Access of Garrett County Residents to the Baltimore and Washington, D.C.
2365.description: Expressing concern that Garrett County residents are unable to receive broadcasts from Baltimore and Washington, D.C. television stations; and urging the Maryland Delegation to Congress to encourage the Federal Communications Commission to amend its television market determination regulations, and to sponsor and support any legislation in the United States Congress to provide Garrett County residents with a choice to receive broadcasts from stations located in Baltimore, Washington, D.C., or Pittsburgh.

2368.title: Public-Private Partnerships to Promote Broadband Internet Access
2368.description: Urging counties and municipalities to promote and facilitate the creation of public-private partnerships to provide access to broadband Internet and related information technology to all State residents, particularly those living in urban centers or underserved communities.
